pros: Great communication, clear objectives and great environment.

job_title: Coordinator of Community Services in Millersville, MD
pros: The benefits are good and the CEO advocates for us.
cons: My program is struggling to stay afloat. Between disrespectful families we serve and the obstacles we constantly face with DDA, it’s no wonder nobody stays very long. A Coordinator can find these challenges anywhere, but the program here is young and still learning.

job_title: Service Coordinator/Supports Planner in Baltimore, MD
pros: You get to work from home.
cons: These people don't have any moral ethics they say they do. I worked there and was one of there exceptional employees. I had family members call the office to praise me on the great job I was doing for there love ones.  However all it takes is for a supervisor to do is say I don't want them on my team anymore and you get a At Will Termination. With no care in the world. The sad part is they all are very tight in that office.  My supervisor use to go out every Friday with other staff and get so drunk but it was ignored by the hired ups. I hate it worked for them they give you a overload of clients and expect to fill these big rolls.

pros: Work-life balance and benefits are very good. Decent pay. Great, supportive coworkers for the most part. Working from home a huge plus.
cons: How you feel is very dependent on what supervisor you're assigned to. Some are very supportive, some are very hard to work with. The organization requires above and beyond state requirements.
